titleStmt.title: William Calhoun et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4370

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To. Gov Bramlette
Governor of Kentucky

The Undersigned petitioners Would Respectfully Represent that at the September Term of the McLean Circuit Court, a Judgment Was Obtained against D H Jones for Fifty Dollars for Keeping a Tipling House We would Represent that Mr. Jones is a Druggist in the Town of Calhoun and if he kept a Tipling it Was Under Circumstances Such that We think Executive Clemency Should be Used and Who Respectfully ask that the fine against Mr Jones be Remitted and We Will Ever

Yours truly
W. B. Rose
Isaac Vertrees
D T Mosby
Philip F Lockett
Azro Dyer
A. H. Edwards
H D Bassett
C G Clark
James Landman
Cam Moseley
Lot Cooper
S H Jung Edden
L. B. Dillard
H F Robards
Robert Dicken
Wm G Day
Wm Calhoun
Alf C Turner
L W Gates
R. W. Allen Provost Marshal McLean Co Ky
J M Payne
T. M. Condit
W. J. Mosely
John Vanhorras
Ch. Schroeder
John Eininier
W C Mosly
S. C. Riggs
L Bracket
R. P. Siske
Thomas C Tichner
Jacob McLaughlin
Logan Riggs
Benj H. Franklin
L M Harris
Ben. F. Harratson
Bird Bracket
Howard Pinkestun
Hilton Tanner
James ^his x mark^Welch
Hugh Jordan
James Porter
W. T. Gipson
W J A Johnston
Thornby Atchison
T. A. Edwards
William ^his X mark^ Riggs
W Bohannon

McLean Cir Ct
vs
D H Jones
